text: The ability of <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to inhibit apoptosis is dependent on stimulus and cell type .

The development of resistance to host defense mechanisms such as tumor necrosis factor ( TNF ) - and <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis of transformed or virus-infected cells may be a critical component in the development of disease .

To find genes that protect cells from apoptosis , we used an expression cloning strategy and identified <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) early-lytic-cycle protein with distant homology to <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , as an anti-apoptosis protein .

Expression of <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in MCF-Fas cells conferred nearly complete resistance against both anti - <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody and TNF - mediated apoptosis .

In addition , <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protected these cells from monocyte - mediated killing but failed to protect them from killing mediated by lymphokine - activated killer cells .

The ability of <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to protect MCF-Fas cells from apoptosis induced by various stimuli was identical to that of <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Bcl-xL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Moreover , the mechanism of action of <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> resembled that of <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Bcl-xL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as it inhibited TNF - and anti - <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced activation of two enzymes participating in the apoptosis pathway , <extra_id_0> cytosolic phospholipase A2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> caspase-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CPP32 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but did not interfere with the activation of NF-kappaB-like transcription factors .

text: A putative function of <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in EBV-infected epithelial cells may be to protect virus-infected cells from TNF - and / or anti - <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced cell death in order to maximize virus production .

Surprisingly , expression of neither <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> nor <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in a B-cell line , BJAB , protected the cells from anti - <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis even though they increased the survival of serum-starved cells .

text: Thus , the protective role of <extra_id_0> BHRF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> against apoptosis resembles that of <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in being cell type specific and dependent on the apoptotic stimulus .
